stmt: If every proper closed set of a topological space is compact, then the space itself is compact.
prompts:
[{"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u} [inst : TopologicalSpace Œ±] [inst_1 : Finite Œ±], CompactSpace Œ±",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "Finite topological spaces are compact. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u} [inst : TopologicalSpace Œ±] [inst_1 : LocallyCompactSpace Œ±] {K : Set Œ±},\n  IsCompact K ‚Üí ‚àÉ K', IsCompact K' ‚àß K ‚äÜ interior K'",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "In a locally compact space, every compact set is contained in the interior of a compact set. "},
 {"theorem": "‚àÄ (self : CompHaus), CompactSpace ‚Üëself.toTop",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "The underlying topological space is compact."},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {X : Type u_1} [inst : TopologicalSpace X], CompactSpace (OnePoint X)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "For any topological space `X`, its one point compactification is a compact space. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_1} [inst : TopologicalSpace Œ±] [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace.NoetherianSpace Œ±] (s : Set Œ±), IsCompact s",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "In a Noetherian space, all sets are compact. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u} [inst : TopologicalSpace Œ±] {s t : Set Œ±}, IsCompact t ‚Üí IsClosed s ‚Üí IsCompact (s ‚à© t)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "The intersection of a closed set and a compact set is a compact set. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ (H : Type u) (M : Type u_1) [inst : TopologicalSpace H] [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace M] [inst_2 : ChartedSpace H M]\n  [inst : LocallyCompactSpace H], LocallyCompactSpace M",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "If a topological space admits an atlas with locally compact charts, then the space itself\nis locally compact. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u} [inst : TopologicalSpace Œ±] [inst_1 : T2Space Œ±] {s : Set Œ±}, IsCompact s ‚Üí IsClosed s",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "In a `T2Space`, every compact set is closed. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u} [inst : TopologicalSpace Œ±] [inst_1 : LocallyCompactSpace Œ±] [inst_2 : T2Space Œ±] {K : Set Œ±},\n  IsCompact K ‚Üí ‚àÉ V, IsOpen V ‚àß K ‚äÜ V ‚àß IsCompact (closure V)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "In a locally compact T‚ÇÇ space, every compact set has an open neighborhood with compact closure.\n"},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u} [inst : EMetricSpace Œ±] [inst_1 : CompactSpace Œ±], CompactSpace (TopologicalSpace.Closeds Œ±)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "In a compact space, the type of closed subsets is compact. "}]

stmt: Every prime that is `1` greater than a multiple of `4` can be expressed as the sum of two squares.
prompts:
[{"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {a b x y u v : ‚Ñï}, a = x ^ 2 + y ^ 2 ‚Üí b = u ^ 2 + v ^ 2 ‚Üí ‚àÉ r s, a * b = r ^ 2 + s ^ 2",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "The set of natural numbers that are sums of two squares is closed under multiplication. "},
 {"theorem": "‚àÄ {n : ‚Ñï}, IsSquare (-1) ‚Üí ‚àÉ x y, n = x ^ 2 + y ^ 2",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "If `-1` is a square modulo the natural number `n`, then `n` is a sum of two squares. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {p : ‚Ñï} [inst : Fact (Nat.Prime p)], p % 4 ‚â† 3 ‚Üí ‚àÉ a b, a ^ 2 + b ^ 2 = p",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "**Fermat's theorem on the sum of two squares**. Every prime not congruent to 3 mod 4 is the sum\nof two squares. Also known as **Fermat's Christmas theorem**. "},
 {"theorem": "‚àÄ (n : ‚Ñï), ‚àÉ a b c d, a ^ 2 + b ^ 2 + c ^ 2 + d ^ 2 = n",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "**Four squares theorem** "},
 {"theorem": "‚àÄ (p : ‚Ñï) [inst : Fact (Nat.Prime p)], Prime ‚Üëp ‚Üî p % 4 = 3",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "A prime natural number is prime in `‚Ñ§[i]` if and only if it is `3` mod `4` "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {p q : ‚Ñï} [inst : Fact (Nat.Prime p)] [inst_1 : Fact (Nat.Prime q)],\n  p % 4 = 1 ‚Üí q ‚â† 2 ‚Üí legendreSym q ‚Üëp = legendreSym p ‚Üëq",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "The Law of Quadratic Reciprocity: if `p` and `q` are odd primes and `p % 4 = 1`,\nthen `(q / p) = (p / q)`. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ (a b c d x y z w : ‚Ñï),\n  Int.natAbs (‚Üëa * ‚Üëx - ‚Üëb * ‚Üëy - ‚Üëc * ‚Üëz - ‚Üëd * ‚Üëw) ^ 2 + Int.natAbs (‚Üëa * ‚Üëy + ‚Üëb * ‚Üëx + ‚Üëc * ‚Üëw - ‚Üëd * ‚Üëz) ^ 2 +\n        Int.natAbs (‚Üëa * ‚Üëz - ‚Üëb * ‚Üëw + ‚Üëc * ‚Üëx + ‚Üëd * ‚Üëy) ^ 2 +\n      Int.natAbs (‚Üëa * ‚Üëw + ‚Üëb * ‚Üëz - ‚Üëc * ‚Üëy + ‚Üëd * ‚Üëx) ^ 2 =\n    (a ^ 2 + b ^ 2 + c ^ 2 + d ^ 2) * (x ^ 2 + y ^ 2 + z ^ 2 + w ^ 2)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "**Euler's four-square identity**, a version for natural numbers. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {F : Type u_1} [inst : Field F] [inst_1 : Finite F], ringChar F = 2 ‚Üí ‚àÄ (a : F), IsSquare a",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "In a finite field of characteristic `2`, all elements are squares. "},
 {"theorem": "Set.InjOn Nat.factorization {x | x ‚â† 0}",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Every nonzero natural number has a unique prime factorization "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {p : ‚Ñï} [inst : Fact (Nat.Prime p)], p ‚â† 2 ‚Üí (IsSquare 2 ‚Üî p % 8 = 1 ‚à® p % 8 = 7)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "`2` is a square modulo an odd prime `p` iff `p` is congruent to `1` or `7` mod `8`. "}]

stmt: The product of two numbers, each of which is the sum of four squares, is itself a sum of four squares.
prompts:
[{"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {a b x y u v : ‚Ñï}, a = x ^ 2 + y ^ 2 ‚Üí b = u ^ 2 + v ^ 2 ‚Üí ‚àÉ r s, a * b = r ^ 2 + s ^ 2",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "The set of natural numbers that are sums of two squares is closed under multiplication. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u} [inst : LinearOrderedRing Œ±] {x y : Œ±}, x * x + y * y = 0 ‚Üî x = 0 ‚àß y = 0",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "The sum of two squares is zero iff both elements are zero. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ (a b c d x y z w : ‚Ñï),\n  Int.natAbs (‚Üëa * ‚Üëx - ‚Üëb * ‚Üëy - ‚Üëc * ‚Üëz - ‚Üëd * ‚Üëw) ^ 2 + Int.natAbs (‚Üëa * ‚Üëy + ‚Üëb * ‚Üëx + ‚Üëc * ‚Üëw - ‚Üëd * ‚Üëz) ^ 2 +\n        Int.natAbs (‚Üëa * ‚Üëz - ‚Üëb * ‚Üëw + ‚Üëc * ‚Üëx + ‚Üëd * ‚Üëy) ^ 2 +\n      Int.natAbs (‚Üëa * ‚Üëw + ‚Üëb * ‚Üëz - ‚Üëc * ‚Üëy + ‚Üëd * ‚Üëx) ^ 2 =\n    (a ^ 2 + b ^ 2 + c ^ 2 + d ^ 2) * (x ^ 2 + y ^ 2 + z ^ 2 + w ^ 2)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "**Euler's four-square identity**, a version for natural numbers. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {R : Type u_1} [inst : CommRing R] (a b c d x y z w : R),\n  (a * x - b * y - c * z - d * w) ^ 2 + (a * y + b * x + c * w - d * z) ^ 2 + (a * z - b * w + c * x + d * y) ^ 2 +\n      (a * w + b * z - c * y + d * x) ^ 2 =\n    (a ^ 2 + b ^ 2 + c ^ 2 + d ^ 2) * (x ^ 2 + y ^ 2 + z ^ 2 + w ^ 2)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "**Euler's four-square identity**. "},
 {"theorem": "‚àÄ (n : ‚Ñï), ‚àÉ a b c d, a ^ 2 + b ^ 2 + c ^ 2 + d ^ 2 = n",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "**Four squares theorem** "},
 {"theorem": "‚àÄ {n : ‚Ñï}, IsSquare (-1) ‚Üí ‚àÉ x y, n = x ^ 2 + y ^ 2",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "If `-1` is a square modulo the natural number `n`, then `n` is a sum of two squares. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ (R : Type u_1) [inst : CommRing R] (m k : ‚Ñï),\n  2 * Polynomial.Chebyshev.T R m * Polynomial.Chebyshev.T R (m + k) =\n    Polynomial.Chebyshev.T R (2 * m + k) + Polynomial.Chebyshev.T R k",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "The product of two Chebyshev polynomials is the sum of two other Chebyshev polynomials. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {R : Type u} [inst : Semiring R] {p q : Polynomial R},\n  p * q =\n    Finset.sum (Polynomial.support p) fun i =>\n      Polynomial.sum q fun j a => ‚Üë(Polynomial.monomial (i + j)) (Polynomial.coeff p i * a)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "Expressing the product of two polynomials as a double sum. "},
 {"theorem": "‚àÄ {m n : ‚Ñï}, (‚àÄ (a : ‚Ñï), m ‚à£ a ‚Üî n ‚à£ a) ‚Üî m = n",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Two natural numbers are equal if and only if they have the same multiples. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {F : Type u_1} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup F] [inst_1 : InnerProductSpace ‚Ñù F] {x y : F},\n  ‚Äñx + y‚Äñ = Real.sqrt (‚Äñx‚Äñ * ‚Äñx‚Äñ + ‚Äñy‚Äñ * ‚Äñy‚Äñ) ‚Üî inner x y = 0",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Pythagorean theorem, if-and-if vector inner product form using square roots. "}]

stmt: A ring with all elements idempotent is commutative.
prompts:
[{"theorem": "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_1} [self : BooleanRing Œ±] (a : Œ±), a * a = a",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "Multiplication in a boolean ring is idempotent. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {R : Type u_1} {S : Type u_2} [inst : Mul R] [inst_1 : Mul S] [inst_2 : Add R] [inst_3 : Add S] (e : R ‚âÉ+* S)\n  (x y : R), ‚Üëe (x * y) = ‚Üëe x * ‚Üëe y",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A ring isomorphism preserves multiplication. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {R : Type u_1} {S : Type u_2} [inst : Mul R] [inst_1 : Mul S] [inst_2 : Add R] [inst_3 : Add S] (e : R ‚âÉ+* S)\n  (x y : R), ‚Üëe (x + y) = ‚Üëe x + ‚Üëe y",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A ring isomorphism preserves addition. "},
 {"theorem": "‚àÄ {S : Type u_1} [inst : Mul S] (a : S), Commute a a",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "Any element commutes with itself. "},
 {"theorem": "‚àÄ {S : Type u_1} [inst : Add S] (a : S), AddCommute a a",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "Any element commutes with itself."},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {R : Type u_2} {S : Type u_1} [inst : NonAssocSemiring R] [inst_1 : NonAssocSemiring S] (f : R ‚âÉ+* S), ‚Üëf 1 = 1",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A ring isomorphism sends one to one. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {R : Type u_2} {S : Type u_1} [inst : NonUnitalNonAssocSemiring R] [inst_1 : NonUnitalNonAssocSemiring S]\n  (f : R ‚âÉ+* S), ‚Üëf 0 = 0",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A ring isomorphism sends zero to zero. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_1} (r : Œ± ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí Prop), EqvGen.Setoid (Setoid.Rel (EqvGen.Setoid r)) = EqvGen.Setoid r",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "Equivalence closure is idempotent. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_1} [self : StrictOrderedCommRing Œ±] (a b : Œ±), a * b = b * a",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "Multiplication is commutative in a commutative semigroup. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {F : Type u_1} {R : outParam (Type u_2)} {S : outParam (Type u_3)} [inst : Mul R] [inst_1 : Add R] [inst_2 : Mul S]\n  [inst_3 : Add S] [self : RingEquivClass F R S] (f : F) (a b : R), ‚Üëf (a + b) = ‚Üëf a + ‚Üëf b",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "By definition, a ring isomorphism preserves the additive structure. "}]

stmt: There are infinitely many pairs of primes that differ exactly by `2`.
prompts:
[{"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {F : Type u_1} [inst : Field F] [inst_1 : Finite F], ringChar F = 2 ‚Üí ‚àÄ (a : F), IsSquare a",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "In a finite field of characteristic `2`, all elements are squares. "},
 {"theorem": "‚àÄ {p : ‚Ñï} [inst : Fact (Nat.Prime p)], p % 2 = 1 ‚Üî p ‚â† 2",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A prime `p` satisfies `p % 2 = 1` if and only if `p ‚â† 2`. "},
 {"theorem": "Set.InjOn Nat.factorization {x | x ‚â† 0}",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Every nonzero natural number has a unique prime factorization "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {a b x y u v : ‚Ñï}, a = x ^ 2 + y ^ 2 ‚Üí b = u ^ 2 + v ^ 2 ‚Üí ‚àÉ r s, a * b = r ^ 2 + s ^ 2",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "The set of natural numbers that are sums of two squares is closed under multiplication. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_1} [inst : LinearOrderedField Œ±] {a : Œ±}, 2 ‚â§ a ‚Üí (1 - 1 / a)‚Åª¬π ‚â§ 2",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "An inequality involving `2`. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {p : ‚Ñï} [inst : Fact (Nat.Prime p)], p ‚â† 2 ‚Üí (IsSquare 2 ‚Üî p % 8 = 1 ‚à® p % 8 = 7)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "`2` is a square modulo an odd prime `p` iff `p` is congruent to `1` or `7` mod `8`. "},
 {"theorem": "‚àÄ {m n : ‚Ñï}, (‚àÄ (a : ‚Ñï), a ‚à£ m ‚Üî a ‚à£ n) ‚Üî m = n",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Two natural numbers are equal if and only if they have the same divisors. "},
 {"theorem": "‚àÄ {m n : ‚Ñï}, (‚àÄ (a : ‚Ñï), m ‚à£ a ‚Üî n ‚à£ a) ‚Üî m = n",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Two natural numbers are equal if and only if they have the same multiples. "},
 {"theorem": "‚àÄ (p : ‚Ñï) [inst : Fact (Nat.Prime p)], Prime ‚Üëp ‚Üî p % 4 = 3",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "A prime natural number is prime in `‚Ñ§[i]` if and only if it is `3` mod `4` "},
 {"theorem": "‚àÄ {m n : ‚Ñï}, Odd n ‚Üí m ‚à£ n ‚Üí m ‚â† 2",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "`2` is not a factor of an odd natural number. "}]

stmt: Every finite division ring is a field.
prompts:
[{"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_1} [inst : Fintype Œ±] [inst_1 : Field Œ±], IsPrimePow (Fintype.card Œ±)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A finite field has prime power cardinality. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {K : Type u_2} {L : Type u_1} [inst : Field K] [inst_1 : Field L] [inst_2 : Algebra K L] (S : IntermediateField K L)\n  {x y : L}, x ‚àà S ‚Üí y ‚àà S ‚Üí x / y ‚àà S",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "An intermediate field is closed under division. "},
 {"theorem": "‚àÄ (K : Type u) [inst : Field K], ValuationRing K",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A field is a valuation ring. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ (S : Set ‚Ñï+) (K : Type w) (L : Type z) [inst : Field K] [inst_1 : Field L] [inst_2 : Algebra K L] [h : NumberField K]\n  [inst_3 : Finite ‚ÜëS] [inst : IsCyclotomicExtension S K L], NumberField L",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "A cyclotomic finite extension of a number field is a number field. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {K : Type u} [inst : Field K] (s : Subfield K) {x y : K}, x ‚àà s ‚Üí y ‚àà s ‚Üí x / y ‚àà s",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A subfield is closed under division. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {R : Type u_1} [inst : CommRing R] [inst_1 : IsDomain R] (S : Subgroup RÀ£) [inst_2 : Finite { x // x ‚àà S }],\n  IsCyclic { x // x ‚àà S }",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "A finite subgroup of the units of an integral domain is cyclic. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ (Œ± : Type u_1) [inst : LinearOrderedField Œ±] [inst_1 : FloorRing Œ±], Archimedean Œ±",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A linear ordered field that is a floor ring is archimedean. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {K : Type u} {V : Type v} [inst : DivisionRing K] [inst_1 : AddCommGroup V] [inst_2 : Module K V],\n  IsNoetherian K V ‚Üî Module.Finite K V",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "A module over a division ring is noetherian if and only if it is finitely generated. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {R : Type u_2} {G : Type u_1} [inst : CommRing R] [inst_1 : IsDomain R] [inst_2 : Group G] [inst_3 : Finite G]\n  (f : G ‚Üí* R), Function.Injective ‚Üëf ‚Üí IsCyclic G",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "A finite subgroup of the unit group of an integral domain is cyclic. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ (K : Type u_1) (L : Type u_2) [inst : Field K] [inst_1 : Field L] [inst_2 : Algebra K L]\n  [inst_3 : FiniteDimensional K L], Algebra.IsAlgebraic K L",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A field extension is algebraic if it is finite. "}]

stmt: If each of two types can be mapped injectively into the other, then there is a bijection between them.
prompts:
[{"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {R : Type u} [inst : CommSemiring R] {M‚ÇÅ : Type v} {M‚ÇÇ : Type v'} [inst_1 : AddCommMonoid M‚ÇÅ] [inst_2 : Module R M‚ÇÅ]\n  [inst_3 : AddCommMonoid M‚ÇÇ] [inst_4 : Module R M‚ÇÇ] {f : M‚ÇÅ ‚Üí‚Çó[R] M‚ÇÇ},\n  Function.Surjective ‚Üëf ‚Üí Function.Injective ‚Üë(LinearMap.dualMap f)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "If a linear map is surjective, then its dual is injective. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {ùïú : Type u_1} [inst : NontriviallyNormedField ùïú] {E : Type u_2} [inst_1 : NormedAddCommGroup E]\n  [inst_2 : NormedSpace ùïú E] {F : Type u_3} [inst_3 : NormedAddCommGroup F] [inst_4 : NormedSpace ùïú F]\n  [inst_5 : CompleteSpace F] [inst_6 : CompleteSpace E] (e : E ‚âÉ‚Çó[ùïú] F),\n  Continuous ‚Üëe ‚Üí Continuous ‚Üë(LinearEquiv.symm e)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "If a bounded linear map is a bijection, then its inverse is also a bounded linear map. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {R : Type u_1} {R‚ÇÇ : Type u_2} {M : Type u_3} {M‚ÇÇ : Type u_4} [inst : Semiring R] [inst_1 : Semiring R‚ÇÇ]\n  [inst_2 : AddCommMonoid M] [inst_3 : AddCommMonoid M‚ÇÇ] [inst_4 : Module R M] [inst_5 : Module R‚ÇÇ M‚ÇÇ] {œÑ‚ÇÅ‚ÇÇ : R ‚Üí+* R‚ÇÇ}\n  {f : M ‚Üí‚Çõ‚Çó[œÑ‚ÇÅ‚ÇÇ] M‚ÇÇ},\n  (‚àÄ (u v : { x // x ‚àà LinearMap.ker f } ‚Üí‚Çó[R] M), LinearMap.comp f u = LinearMap.comp f v ‚Üí u = v) ‚Üí\n    LinearMap.ker f = ‚ä•",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A monomorphism is injective. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {X Y : Type u} (f : X ‚ü∂ Y), CategoryTheory.IsIso f ‚Üî Function.Bijective f",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "A morphism in `Type u` is an isomorphism if and only if it is bijective. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {M : Type u_1} [inst : Mul M] {c d : Con M}, c.toSetoid = d.toSetoid ‚Üí c = d",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "The map sending a congruence relation to its underlying equivalence relation is injective. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {K : Type u} {V : Type v} [inst : DivisionRing K] [inst_1 : AddCommGroup V] [inst_2 : Module K V]\n  [inst_3 : FiniteDimensional K V] {f : V ‚Üí‚Çó[K] V}, Function.Injective ‚Üëf ‚Üí Function.Surjective ‚Üëf",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "On a finite-dimensional space, an injective linear map is surjective. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {C : Type u} [inst : CategoryTheory.Category C] [inst_1 : CategoryTheory.ConcreteCategory C] {X Y : C} (f : X ‚ü∂ Y),\n  Function.Injective ‚Üëf ‚Üí CategoryTheory.Mono f",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "In any concrete category, injective morphisms are monomorphisms. "},
 {"theorem":

stmt: The number of partitions with odd parts is equal to the number of partitions with distinct parts.
prompts:
[{"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_1} [inst : Fintype Œ±] {P : Finpartition Finset.univ} {hP : Finpartition.IsEquipartition P}\n  {G : SimpleGraph Œ±} {Œµ : ‚Ñù},\n  Finset.card P.parts * 16 ^ Finset.card P.parts ‚â§ Fintype.card Œ± ‚Üí\n    ¬¨Finpartition.IsUniform P G Œµ ‚Üí\n      Finset.card (SzemerediRegularity.increment hP G Œµ).parts = SzemerediRegularity.stepBound (Finset.card P.parts)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "The increment partition has a prescribed (very big) size in terms of the original partition. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_1} [inst : Lattice Œ±] [inst_1 : OrderBot Œ±] {a : Œ±} (self : Finpartition a), Finset.SupIndep self.parts id",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "The partition is supremum-independent "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_1} (f : Finpartition Set.univ), Setoid.IsPartition ‚Üëf.parts",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A finpartition gives rise to a setoid partition "},
 {"theorem": "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_1} {r : Setoid Œ±} (a : Œ±), ‚àÉ! b x, a ‚àà b",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "Equivalence classes partition the type. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_1} [inst : Fintype Œ±] {P : Finpartition Finset.univ} {G : SimpleGraph Œ±} {Œµ : ‚Ñù} [inst_1 : Nonempty Œ±]\n  (hP : Finpartition.IsEquipartition P),\n  7 ‚â§ Finset.card P.parts ‚Üí\n    100 < 4 ^ Finset.card P.parts * Œµ ^ 5 ‚Üí\n      Finset.card P.parts * 16 ^ Finset.card P.parts ‚â§ Fintype.card Œ± ‚Üí\n        ¬¨Finpartition.IsUniform P G Œµ ‚Üí\n          Œµ ‚â§ 1 ‚Üí\n            ‚Üë(Finpartition.energy P G) + Œµ ^ 5 / 4 ‚â§ ‚Üë(Finpartition.energy (SzemerediRegularity.increment hP G Œµ) G)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "The increment partition has energy greater than the original one by a known fixed amount. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {ùïú : Type uùïú} {G : Type uG} {E : Type uE} {E' : Type uE'} {F : Type uF} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup E]\n  [inst_1 : NormedAddCommGroup E'] [inst_2 : NormedAddCommGroup F] {f : G ‚Üí E} {g : G ‚Üí E'} {x : G}\n  [inst_3 : NontriviallyNormedField ùïú] [inst_4 : NormedSpace ùïú E] [inst_5 : NormedSpace ùïú E'] [inst_6 : NormedSpace ùïú F]\n  (L : E ‚ÜíL[ùïú] E' ‚ÜíL[ùïú] F) [inst_7 : MeasurableSpace G] {Œº : MeasureTheory.Measure G} [inst_8 : NormedSpace ‚Ñù F]\n  [inst_9 : AddCommGroup G] [inst_10 : MeasureTheory.Measure.IsAddLeftInvariant Œº]\n  [inst_11 : MeasureTheory.Measure.IsNegInvariant Œº] [inst_12 : MeasurableNeg G] [inst_13 : MeasurableAdd G],\n  (‚àÄ·µê (x : G) ‚àÇŒº, f (-x) = f x) ‚Üí (‚àÄ·µê (x : G) ‚àÇŒº, g (-x) = g x) ‚Üí convolution f g L (-x) = convolution f g L x",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "The convolution of two even functions is also even. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ≤ : Type u} {Œ± : Type v} {s : Finset Œ±} {f : Œ± ‚Üí Œ≤} [inst : AddCommMonoid Œ≤] (R : Setoid Œ±)\n  [inst_1 : DecidableRel Setoid.r],\n  (Finset.sum s fun x => f x) =\n    Finset.sum (Finset.image Quotient.mk'' s) fun xbar =>\n      Finset.sum (Finset.filter (fun x => Quotient.mk R x = xbar) s) fun y => f y",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "A sum can be partitioned into a sum of sums, each equivalent under a setoid."},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œπ : Type u_1} {Œ± : Type u_2} {s : Œπ ‚Üí Set Œ±} (hs : IndexedPartition s) (x : IndexedPartition.Quotient hs),\n  IndexedPartition.index hs (Quotient.out' x) = IndexedPartition.index hs (‚Üë(IndexedPartition.out hs) x)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "The indices of `Quotient.out'` and `IndexedPartition.out` are equal. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ≤ : Type u} {Œ± : Type v} {s : Finset Œ±} {f : Œ± ‚Üí Œ≤} [inst : AddCommMonoid Œ≤] (R : Setoid Œ±)\n  [inst_1 : DecidableRel Setoid.r],\n  (‚àÄ (x : Œ±), x ‚àà s ‚Üí (Finset.sum (Finset.filter (fun y => y ‚âà x) s) fun a => f a) = 0) ‚Üí\n    (Finset.sum s fun x => f x) = 0",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "If we can partition a sum into subsets that cancel out, then the whole sum cancels."},
 {"theorem": "‚àÄ {m n : ‚Ñï}, (‚àÄ (a : ‚Ñï), a ‚à£ m ‚Üî a ‚à£ n) ‚Üî m = n",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Two natural numbers are equal if and only if they have the same divisors. "}]

stmt: Every non-empty poset in which every chain has an upper bound contains a maximal element.
prompts:
[{"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_1} {r : Œ± ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí Prop} [inst : Nonempty Œ±],\n  (‚àÄ (c : Set Œ±), IsChain r c ‚Üí Set.Nonempty c ‚Üí ‚àÉ ub, ‚àÄ (a : Œ±), a ‚àà c ‚Üí r a ub) ‚Üí\n    (‚àÄ {a b c : Œ±}, r a b ‚Üí r b c ‚Üí r a c) ‚Üí ‚àÉ m, ‚àÄ (a : Œ±), r m a ‚Üí r a m",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "A variant of Zorn's lemma. If every nonempty chain of a nonempty type has an upper bound, then\nthere is a maximal element.\n"},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_1} {r : Œ± ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí Prop},\n  (‚àÄ (c : Set Œ±), IsChain r c ‚Üí ‚àÉ ub, ‚àÄ (a : Œ±), a ‚àà c ‚Üí r a ub) ‚Üí\n    (‚àÄ {a b c : Œ±}, r a b ‚Üí r b c ‚Üí r a c) ‚Üí ‚àÉ m, ‚àÄ (a : Œ±), r m a ‚Üí r a m",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "**Zorn's lemma**\n\nIf every chain has an upper bound, then there exists a maximal element. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_1} {r : Œ± ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí Prop} {c : Set Œ±}, IsChain r c ‚Üí ‚àÉ M, IsMaxChain r M ‚àß c ‚äÜ M",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Every chain is contained in a maximal chain. This generalizes Hausdorff's maximality principle.\n"},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {R : Type u} [inst : CommRing R] (c : Set (Ideal R)),\n  c ‚äÜ nonPrincipals R ‚Üí\n    IsChain (fun x x_1 => x ‚â§ x_1) c ‚Üí\n      ‚àÄ {K : Ideal R}, K ‚àà c ‚Üí ‚àÉ I, I ‚àà nonPrincipals R ‚àß ‚àÄ (J : Ideal R), J ‚àà c ‚Üí J ‚â§ I",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Any chain in the set of non-principal ideals has an upper bound which is non-principal.\n(Namely, the union of the chain is such an upper bound.)\n"},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_1} [self : CompleteBooleanAlgebra Œ±] (s : Set Œ±) (a : Œ±), (‚àÄ (b : Œ±), b ‚àà s ‚Üí b ‚â§ a) ‚Üí sSup s ‚â§ a",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "Any upper bound is more than the set supremum. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u} [inst : Preorder Œ±] [inst_1 : OrderTop Œ±] (s : Set Œ±), BddAbove s",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "When there is a global maximum, every set is bounded above. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u} {Œ≤ : Type v} [inst : SemilatticeSup Œ±] [inst_1 : Nonempty Œ±] {I : Set Œ≤} {S : Œ≤ ‚Üí Set Œ±},\n  Set.Finite I ‚Üí (BddAbove (‚ãÉ (i : Œ≤) (_ : i ‚àà I), S i) ‚Üî ‚àÄ (i : Œ≤), i ‚àà I ‚Üí BddAbove (S i))",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "A finite union of sets which are all bounded above is still bounded above."},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u} [inst : SemilatticeSup Œ±] [inst_1 : Nonempty Œ±] {s : Set Œ±}, Set.Finite s ‚Üí BddAbove s",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A finite set is bounded above."},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ≥ : Type w} [inst : SemilatticeSup Œ≥] {s t : Set Œ≥}, BddAbove (s ‚à™ t) ‚Üî BddAbove s ‚àß BddAbove t",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "The union of two sets is bounded above if and only if each of the sets is. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_1} [inst : TopologicalSpace Œ±] {C : Set Œ±} [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace.SecondCountableTopology Œ±],\n  IsClosed C ‚Üí ¬¨Set.Countable C ‚Üí ‚àÉ D, Perfect D ‚àß Set.Nonempty D ‚àß D ‚äÜ C",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Any uncountable closed set in a second countable space contains a nonempty perfect subset."}]

stmt: A group whose automorphism group is cyclic is Abelian.

stmt: A uniformly continuous function of a uniformly continuous function is uniformly continuous.
prompts:
[{"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u} {Œ≤ : Type v} {Œπ : Type x} [inst : UniformSpace Œ≤] {F : Œπ ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí Œ≤} {f : Œ± ‚Üí Œ≤} {p : Filter Œπ}\n  [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace Œ±],\n  TendstoUniformly F f p ‚Üí (‚àÄ·∂† (n : Œπ) in p, Continuous (F n)) ‚Üí ‚àÄ [inst_2 : Filter.NeBot p], Continuous f",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A uniform limit of continuous functions is continuous. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œπ : Type u_1} {Œ± : Type u_2} {Œ≤ : Type u_3} [inst : UniformSpace Œ±] [inst_1 : UniformSpace Œ≤] {F : Œπ ‚Üí Œ≤ ‚Üí Œ±},\n  UniformEquicontinuous F ‚Üí ‚àÄ (i : Œπ), UniformContinuous (F i)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Each function of a uniformly equicontinuous family is uniformly continuous. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u} {Œ≤ : Type v} [inst : UniformSpace Œ≤] {f : Œ± ‚Üí Œ≤} [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace Œ±],\n  (‚àÄ (u : Set (Œ≤ √ó Œ≤)), u ‚àà uniformity Œ≤ ‚Üí ‚àÉ F, Continuous F ‚àß ‚àÄ (y : Œ±), (f y, F y) ‚àà u) ‚Üí Continuous f",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "A function which can be uniformly approximated by continuous functions is continuous. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u} {Œ≤ : Type v} {Œπ : Type x} [inst : UniformSpace Œ≤] {F : Œπ ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí Œ≤} {f : Œ± ‚Üí Œ≤} {p : Filter Œπ}\n  [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace Œ±],\n  TendstoLocallyUniformly F f p ‚Üí (‚àÄ·∂† (n : Œπ) in p, Continuous (F n)) ‚Üí ‚àÄ [inst_2 : Filter.NeBot p], Continuous f",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "A locally uniform limit of continuous functions is continuous. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u} {Œ≤ : Type v} [inst : UniformSpace Œ≤] {f : Œ± ‚Üí Œ≤} [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace Œ±],\n  (‚àÄ (x : Œ±) (u : Set (Œ≤ √ó Œ≤)),\n      u ‚àà uniformity Œ≤ ‚Üí ‚àÉ t, t ‚àà nhds x ‚àß ‚àÉ F, ContinuousAt F x ‚àß ‚àÄ (y : Œ±), y ‚àà t ‚Üí (f y, F y) ‚àà u) ‚Üí\n    Continuous f",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "A function which can be locally uniformly approximated by continuous functions is continuous. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_2} {Œ≤ : Type u_1} {Œπ : Type u_3} {m : MeasurableSpace Œ±} (Œº : MeasureTheory.Measure Œ±)\n  [inst : NormedAddCommGroup Œ≤] {p : ENNReal} {g : Œ± ‚Üí Œ≤},\n  1 ‚â§ p ‚Üí p ‚â† ‚ä§ ‚Üí MeasureTheory.Mem‚Ñíp g p ‚Üí MeasureTheory.UnifIntegrable (fun x => g) p Œº",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A constant function is uniformly integrable. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_1} {Œ≤ : Type u_2} [inst : UniformSpace Œ±] [inst_1 : UniformSpace Œ≤] (self : Œ± ‚âÉ·µ§ Œ≤),\n  UniformContinuous self.toFun",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "Uniform continuity of the function "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u} {Œ≤ : Type v} [inst : UniformSpace Œ≤] {f : Œ± ‚Üí Œ≤} {s : Set Œ±} [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace Œ±],\n  (‚àÄ (u : Set (Œ≤ √ó Œ≤)), u ‚àà uniformity Œ≤ ‚Üí ‚àÉ F, ContinuousOn F s ‚àß ‚àÄ (y : Œ±), y ‚àà s ‚Üí (f y, F y) ‚àà u) ‚Üí ContinuousOn f s",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "A function which can be uniformly approximated by functions which are continuous on a set\nis continuous on this set. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_3} {Œ≤ : Type u_2} [inst : UniformSpace Œ±] [inst_1 : UniformSpace Œ≤] {Œπ : Type u_1} {F : Œπ ‚Üí Œ≤ ‚Üí Œ±}\n  [inst_2 : CompactSpace Œ≤], Equicontinuous F ‚Üí UniformEquicontinuous F",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":

stmt: Every surjective homomorphism from a finitely generated free group to itself is injective.
prompts:
[{"theorem":

  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A group homomorphism is injective iff its kernel is trivial. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {R : Type u_1} {M : Type u_2} [inst : Ring R] [inst_1 : AddCommGroup M] [inst_2 : Module R M]\n  [inst_3 : IsNoetherian R M] (f : M ‚Üí‚Çó[R] M), Function.Surjective ‚Üëf ‚Üí Function.Injective ‚Üëf",

  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Any injective endomorphism of an Artinian module is surjective. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u} {Œ≤ : Type v} [inst : AddGroup Œ±] [inst_1 : AddGroup Œ≤] {f : Œ± ‚Üí Œ≤},\n  IsAddGroupHom f ‚Üí (Function.Injective f ‚Üî ‚àÄ (a : Œ±), f a = 0 ‚Üí a = 0)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "An additive group homomorphism is injective if its kernel is trivial."},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {K : Type u} {V : Type v} [inst : DivisionRing K] [inst_1 : AddCommGroup V] [inst_2 : Module K V]\n  [inst_3 : FiniteDimensional K V] {f : V ‚Üí‚Çó[K] V}, Function.Injective ‚Üëf ‚Üí Function.Surjective ‚Üëf",
  "isProp": true,

 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œπ : Type u_1} {K : Type u_2} {R : Type u_3} [inst : Field K] [inst_1 : Finite K] [inst_2 : CommRing R]\n  [inst_3 : Finite Œπ] [inst_4 : Algebra K R],\n  Algebra.IsAlgebraic K R ‚Üí\n    ‚àÄ (ps : Œπ ‚Üí MvPolynomial Œπ R),\n      (Function.Injective fun v i => ‚Üë(MvPolynomial.eval v) (ps i)) ‚Üí\n        Function.Surjective fun v i => ‚Üë(MvPolynomial.eval v) (ps i)",
  "isProp": true,

  "Any injective polynomial map over an algebraic extension of a finite field is surjective. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {R : Type u_1} {M : Type u_2} [inst : Ring R] [inst_1 : AddCommGroup M] [inst_2 : Module R M]\n  [inst_3 : IsArtinian R M] (f : M ‚Üí‚Çó[R] M), Function.Injective ‚Üëf ‚Üí Function.Bijective ‚Üëf",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Any injective endomorphism of an Artinian module is bijective. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {R : Type u_1} {M : Type u_2} [inst : Ring R] [inst_1 : AddCommGroup M] [inst_2 : Module R M]\n  [inst_3 : IsNoetherian R M] (f : M ‚Üí‚Çó[R] M), Function.Surjective ‚Üëf ‚Üí Function.Bijective ‚Üëf",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Any surjective endomorphism of a Noetherian module is bijective. "},

stmt: Every positive even integer can be written as the sum of two primes.
prompts:
[{"theorem": "Set.InjOn Nat.factorization {x | x ‚â† 0}",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Every nonzero natural number has a unique prime factorization "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {a b x y u v : ‚Ñï}, a = x ^ 2 + y ^ 2 ‚Üí b = u ^ 2 + v ^ 2 ‚Üí ‚àÉ r s, a * b = r ^ 2 + s ^ 2",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "The set of natural numbers that are sums of two squares is closed under multiplication. "},
 {"theorem": "‚àÄ {m n : ‚Ñï}, (‚àÄ (a : ‚Ñï), a ‚à£ m ‚Üî a ‚à£ n) ‚Üî m = n",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Two natural numbers are equal if and only if they have the same divisors. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ (a b : ‚Ñï), a ‚â† 0 ‚Üí b ‚â† 0 ‚Üí (a = b ‚Üî ‚àÄ (p : ‚Ñï), Nat.Prime p ‚Üí padicValNat p a = padicValNat p b)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Two positive naturals are equal if their prime padic valuations are equal "},
 {"theorem": "‚àÄ {m n : ‚Ñï}, (‚àÄ (a : ‚Ñï), m ‚à£ a ‚Üî n ‚à£ a) ‚Üî m = n",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Two natural numbers are equal if and only if they have the same multiples. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_1} [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero Œ±] [dec_irr : (p : Associates Œ±) ‚Üí Decidable (Irreducible p)]\n  [inst_1 : UniqueFactorizationMonoid Œ±] [dec : DecidableEq Œ±] [dec' : DecidableEq (Associates Œ±)] {a p : Associates Œ±},\n  Irreducible p ‚Üí\n    ‚àÄ [inst_2 : (n : ‚Ñï) ‚Üí Decidable (a ‚à£ p ^ n)] {n : ‚Ñï} (h : a ‚à£ p ^ n),\n      a = p ^ Nat.find (_ : ‚àÉ n, (fun n => a ‚à£ p ^ n) n)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "The only divisors of prime powers are prime powers. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {a b : ‚Ñï},\n  a ‚â† 0 ‚Üí b ‚â† 0 ‚Üí List.toFinset (Nat.factors (a * b)) = List.toFinset (Nat.factors a) ‚à™ List.toFinset (Nat.factors b)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "If `a`, `b` are positive, the prime divisors of `a * b` are the union of those of `a` and `b` "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u} [self : StrictOrderedRing Œ±] (a b : Œ±), 0 < a ‚Üí 0 < b ‚Üí 0 < a * b",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "The product of two positive elements is positive. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u} [inst : Semiring Œ±] {I : Ideal Œ±} [self : Ideal.IsPrime I] {x y : Œ±}, x * y ‚àà I ‚Üí x ‚àà I ‚à® y ‚àà I",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "If a product lies in the prime ideal, then at least one element lies in the prime ideal. "},
 {"theorem": "‚àÄ (self : ‚Ñö), Nat.coprime (Int.natAbs self.num) self.den",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "The numerator and denominator are coprime: it is in \"reduced form\". "}]

stmt: Every matrix satisfies its own characteristic polynomial.
prompts:
[{"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_2} {n : Type u_1} [inst : DecidableEq n] [inst_1 : Zero Œ±] [inst_2 : One Œ±], Matrix.IsDiag 1",
  "isProp": true,

 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {œÉ : Type u_1} {R : Type u_2} [inst : CommSemiring R] (p : MvPolynomial œÉ R),\n  ‚àÉ n f _hf q, p = ‚Üë(MvPolynomial.rename f) q",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "Every polynomial is a polynomial in finitely many variables. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {A : Type u_1} {B : Type u_2} [inst : Field A] [inst_1 : Ring B] [inst_2 : IsDomain B] [inst_3 : Algebra A B] {x : B},\n  IsIntegral A x ‚Üí x ‚â† 0 ‚Üí Polynomial.coeff (minpoly A x) 0 ‚â† 0",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "The minimal polynomial of a nonzero element has nonzero constant coefficient. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {R : Type u} {M : Type v} [inst : CommRing R] [inst_1 : Nontrivial R] [inst_2 : AddCommGroup M] [inst_3 : Module R M]\n  [inst_4 : Module.Free R M] [inst_5 : Module.Finite R M] (f : M ‚Üí‚Çó[R] M) {Œπ : Type w} [inst_6 : Fintype Œπ]\n  (b : Basis Œπ R M), Matrix.charpoly (‚Üë(LinearMap.toMatrix b b) f) = LinearMap.charpoly f",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "`charpoly f` is the characteristic polynomial of the matrix of `f` in any basis. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {R : Type u} [inst : CommRing R] {n : Type v} [inst_1 : DecidableEq n] [inst_2 : Fintype n] (M : Matrix n n R)\n  (p : Polynomial R), ‚Üë(Polynomial.aeval M) p = ‚Üë(Polynomial.aeval M) (p %‚Çò Matrix.charpoly M)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Any matrix polynomial `p` is equivalent under evaluation to `p %‚Çò M.charpoly`; that is, `p`\nis equivalent to a polynomial with degree less than the dimension of the matrix. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {R : Type u_1} {M : Type u_3} [inst : CommSemiring R] {œÉ : Type u_2} [inst_1 : AddCommMonoid M] (w : œÉ ‚Üí M)\n  (œÜ : MvPolynomial œÉ R), ‚àë·∂† (m : M), ‚Üë(MvPolynomial.weightedHomogeneousComponent w m) œÜ = œÜ",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Every polynomial is the sum of its weighted homogeneous components. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {R : Type u} [inst : CommSemiring R] (I : Ideal (Polynomial R)) (p : Polynomial R),\n  (‚àÄ (n : ‚Ñï), Polynomial.coeff p n ‚àà Ideal.comap Polynomial.C I) ‚Üí p ‚àà I",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "If every coefficient of a polynomial is in an ideal `I`, then so is the polynomial itself "},
 {"theorem": "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_1} {n : Type u_2} [inst : Zero Œ±], Matrix.IsDiag 0",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "Every zero matrix is diagonal. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {A : Type u_1} {B : Type u_2} [inst : CommRing A] [inst_1 : Ring B] [inst_2 : Algebra A B] {x : B},\n  IsIntegral A x ‚Üí Polynomial.Monic (minpoly A x)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A minimal polynomial is monic. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {A : Type u_1} {B : Type u_2} [inst : CommRing A] [inst_1 : Ring B] [inst_2 : Algebra A B] {x : B}\n  [inst_3 : IsDomain A] [inst_4 : IsDomain B], IsIntegral A x ‚Üí Irreducible (minpoly A x)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A minimal polynomial is irreducible. "}]

  "‚àÄ {ùïú : Type uùïú} {G : Type uG} {E : Type uE} {E' : Type uE'} {F : Type uF} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup E]\n  [inst_1 : NormedAddCommGroup E'] [inst_2 : NormedAddCommGroup F] {f : G ‚Üí E} {g : G ‚Üí E'} {x : G}\n  [inst_3 : NontriviallyNormedField ùïú] [inst_4 : NormedSpace ùïú E] [inst_5 : NormedSpace ùïú E'] [inst_6 : NormedSpace ùïú F]\n  (L : E ‚ÜíL[ùïú] E' ‚ÜíL[ùïú] F) [inst_7 : MeasurableSpace G] {Œº : MeasureTheory.Measure G} [inst_8 : NormedSpace ‚Ñù F]\n  [inst_9 : AddCommGroup G] [inst_10 : MeasureTheory.Measure.IsAddLeftInvariant Œº]\n  [inst_11 : MeasureTheory.Measure.IsNegInvariant Œº] [inst_12 : MeasurableNeg G] [inst_13 : MeasurableAdd G],\n  (‚àÄ·µê (x : G) ‚àÇŒº, f (-x) = f x) ‚Üí (‚àÄ·µê (x : G) ‚àÇŒº, g (-x) = g x) ‚Üí convolution f g L (-x) = convolution f g L x",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "The convolution of two even functions is also even. "},
 {"theorem": "‚àÄ {m n : ‚Ñï}, (‚àÄ (a : ‚Ñï), m ‚à£ a ‚Üî n ‚à£ a) ‚Üî m = n",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Two natural numbers are equal if and only if they have the same multiples. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {F : Type u_1} [inst : Field F] [inst_1 : Finite F], ringChar F = 2 ‚Üí ‚àÄ (a : F), IsSquare a",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "In a finite field of characteristic `2`, all elements are squares. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ (a b c d x y z w : ‚Ñï),\n  Int.natAbs (‚Üëa * ‚Üëx - ‚Üëb * ‚Üëy - ‚Üëc * ‚Üëz - ‚Üëd * ‚Üëw) ^ 2 + Int.natAbs (‚Üëa * ‚Üëy + ‚Üëb * ‚Üëx + ‚Üëc * ‚Üëw - ‚Üëd * ‚Üëz) ^ 2 +\n        Int.natAbs (‚Üëa * ‚Üëz - ‚Üëb * ‚Üëw + ‚Üëc * ‚Üëx + ‚Üëd * ‚Üëy) ^ 2 +\n      Int.natAbs (‚Üëa * ‚Üëw + ‚Üëb * ‚Üëz - ‚Üëc * ‚Üëy + ‚Üëd * ‚Üëx) ^ 2 =\n    (a ^ 2 + b ^ 2 + c ^ 2 + d ^ 2) * (x ^ 2 + y ^ 2 + z ^ 2 + w ^ 2)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "**Euler's four-square identity**, a version for natural numbers. "},
 {"theorem": "‚àÄ {n : ‚Ñï}, IsSquare (-1) ‚Üí ‚àÉ x y, n = x ^ 2 + y ^ 2",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "If `-1` is a square modulo the natural number `n`, then `n` is a sum of two squares. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {F : Type u_1} [inst : Field F] [inst_1 : Fintype F] [inst_2 : DecidableEq F] {a : F},\n  a ‚â† 0 ‚Üí ‚Üë(quadraticChar F) a ^ 2 = 1",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "The square of the quadratic character on nonzero arguments is `1`. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {R : Type u} {S : Type v} [inst : CommRing R] [inst_1 : CommRing S] {R' : Type u_1} {S' : Type u_2}\n  [inst_2 : CommRing R'] [inst_3 : CommRing S'] {f : R ‚Üí+* S} {f' : R' ‚Üí+* S'} {g : R ‚Üí+* R'} {g' : S ‚Üí+* S'}\n  (hfg : RingHom.comp f' g = RingHom.comp g' f) (I : Ideal S'),\n  let leq := (_ : Ideal.comap f (Ideal.comap g' I) ‚â§ Ideal.comap g (Ideal.comap f' I));\n  RingHom.comp (Ideal.quotientMap I g' (_ : Ideal.comap g' I ‚â§ Ideal.comap g' I))\n      (Ideal.quotientMap (Ideal.comap g' I) f\n        (_ : Ideal.comap f (Ideal.comap g' I) ‚â§ Ideal.comap f (Ideal.comap g' I))) =\n    RingHom.comp (Ideal.quotientMap I f' (_ : Ideal.comap f' I ‚â§ Ideal.comap f' I))\n      (Ideal.quotientMap (Ideal.comap f' I) g leq)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":

  "isProp": true,
  "docString":

stmt: In a finite commutative ring, all prime ideals are maximal.
prompts:
[{"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {R : Type u} [inst : CommRing R],\n  (‚àÄ (P : Ideal R), Ideal.IsPrime P ‚Üí Submodule.IsPrincipal P) ‚Üí IsPrincipalIdealRing R",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "If all prime ideals in a commutative ring are principal, so are all other ideals. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {R : Type u} [inst : CommRing R] (I : Ideal R), IsField (R ‚ß∏ I) ‚Üí Ideal.IsMaximal I",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "If the quotient by an ideal is a field, then the ideal is maximal. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {R : Type u} [inst : CommRing R] (I : Ideal R), Ideal.IsMaximal I ‚Üî IsField (R ‚ß∏ I)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "The quotient of a ring by an ideal is a field iff the ideal is maximal. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {R : Type u_1} [inst : NormedRing R] [inst_1 : CompleteSpace R] {I : Ideal R} [hI : Ideal.IsMaximal I], IsClosed ‚ÜëI",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "Maximal ideals in complete normed rings are closed. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {R : Type u_1} [inst : CommRing R],\n  Set.Finite {I | Ideal.IsMaximal I} ‚Üí ‚àÄ {I : Ideal R}, IsUnit ‚ÜëI ‚Üí Submodule.IsPrincipal I",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "An invertible ideal in a commutative ring with finitely many maximal ideals is principal.\n\nhttps://math.stackexchange.com/a/95857 "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ (Œ± : Type u) [inst : Semiring Œ±] [inst_1 : Nontrivial Œ±], ‚àÉ M, Ideal.IsMaximal M",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "Krull's theorem: a nontrivial ring has a maximal ideal. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {R : Type u} [inst : CommRing R] [self : IsBezout R] (I : Ideal R), Ideal.FG I ‚Üí Submodule.IsPrincipal I",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "Any finitely generated ideal is principal. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {R : Type u_2} [inst : CommRing R] {A : Type u_1} [inst_1 : CommRing A] [inst_2 : Algebra R A] {S : Submonoid R}\n  [inst_3 : IsLocalization S A],\n  S ‚â§ nonZeroDivisors R ‚Üí\n    Set.Finite {I | Ideal.IsMaximal I} ‚Üí ‚àÄ (I I' : FractionalIdeal S A), I * I' = 1 ‚Üí Submodule.IsPrincipal ‚ÜëI",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "An invertible fractional ideal of a commutative ring with finitely many maximal ideals is principal.\n\nhttps://math.stackexchange.com/a/95857 "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u} [inst : Semiring Œ±] {I : Ideal Œ±} [self : Ideal.IsMaximal I], IsCoatom I",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "The maximal ideal is a coatom in the ordering on ideals; that is, it is not the entire ring,\nand there are no other proper ideals strictly containing it. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ (R : Type u_1) [inst : Semiring R], IsNoetherianRing R ‚Üî ‚àÄ (I : Ideal R), Ideal.FG I",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "A ring is Noetherian if and only if all its ideals are finitely-generated. "}]

stmt: A topological space $X$ is Hausdorff if and only if the diagonal is a closed set in $X √ó X$.
prompts:
[{"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u} {Œ≤ : Type v} [inst : TopologicalSpace Œ±] [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace Œ≤] [inst_2 : CompactSpace Œ±]\n  [inst_3 : T2Space Œ≤] {f : Œ± ‚Üí Œ≤}, Continuous f ‚Üí IsClosedMap f",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "A continuous map from a compact space to a Hausdorff space is a closed map. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u} [inst : PseudoMetricSpace Œ±] {s : Set Œ±} [inst_1 : T2Space Œ±] [inst_2 : ProperSpace Œ±],\n  IsCompact s ‚Üî IsClosed s ‚àß Metric.Bounded s",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "The **Heine‚ÄìBorel theorem**:\nIn a proper Hausdorff space, a set is compact if and only if it is closed and bounded. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u} [inst : TopologicalSpace Œ±] [self : T2Space Œ±] (x y : Œ±),\n  x ‚â† y ‚Üí ‚àÉ u v, IsOpen u ‚àß IsOpen v ‚àß x ‚àà u ‚àß y ‚àà v ‚àß Disjoint u v",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Every two points in a Hausdorff space admit disjoint open neighbourhoods. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u} [inst : EMetricSpace Œ±] [inst_1 : CompleteSpace Œ±], CompleteSpace (TopologicalSpace.Closeds Œ±)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "In a complete space, the type of closed subsets is complete for the\nHausdorff edistance. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u} [inst : PseudoMetricSpace Œ±] {s t : Set Œ±},\n  IsClosed s ‚Üí IsClosed t ‚Üí EMetric.hausdorffEdist s t ‚â† ‚ä§ ‚Üí (Metric.hausdorffDist s t = 0 ‚Üî s = t)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Two closed sets are at zero Hausdorff distance if and only if they coincide "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {H : Type u_1} [inst : TopologicalSpace H] [inst_1 : LocallyCompactSpace H] [inst_2 : T2Space H],\n  TotallyDisconnectedSpace H ‚Üî TotallySeparatedSpace H",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "A locally compact Hausdorff space is totally disconnected\nif and only if it is totally separated. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {H : Type u_1} [inst : TopologicalSpace H] [inst_1 : LocallyCompactSpace H] [inst_2 : T2Space H]\n  [inst_3 : TotallyDisconnectedSpace H], TopologicalSpace.IsTopologicalBasis {s | IsClopen s}",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "A locally compact Hausdorff totally disconnected space has a basis with clopen elements. "},
 {"theorem": "‚àÄ {X Y : CompHaus} (f : X ‚ü∂ Y), IsClosedMap ‚Üëf",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Any continuous function on compact Hausdorff spaces is a closed map. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u} [inst : PseudoEMetricSpace Œ±] {s t : Set Œ±},\n  IsClosed s ‚Üí IsClosed t ‚Üí (EMetric.hausdorffEdist s t = 0 ‚Üî s = t)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Two closed sets are at zero Hausdorff edistance if and only if they coincide "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {X : Type u_1} [inst : TopologicalSpace X] [inst_1 : LocallyCompactSpace X] [inst_2 : T2Space X],\n  NormalSpace (OnePoint X)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "The one point compactification of a locally compact Hausdorff space is a normal (hence,\nHausdorff and regular) topological space. "}]

stmt: If every point of a subset of a topological space is contained in some open set, the subset itself is open.
prompts:
[{"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u} [inst : TopologicalSpace Œ±] [inst_1 : T2Space Œ±] [inst_2 : CompactSpace Œ±]\n  [inst_3 : TotallyDisconnectedSpace Œ±] {x : Œ±} {U : Set Œ±}, IsOpen U ‚Üí x ‚àà U ‚Üí ‚àÉ V, IsClopen V ‚àß x ‚àà V ‚àß V ‚äÜ U",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Every member of an open set in a compact Hausdorff totally disconnected space\nis contained in a clopen set contained in the open set.  "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_1} [t : TopologicalSpace Œ±], t = ‚ä§ ‚Üí ‚àÄ (U : TopologicalSpace.Opens Œ±), U = ‚ä• ‚à® U = ‚ä§",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "An open set in the indiscrete topology is either empty or the whole space. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u} [inst : TopologicalSpace Œ±] {s t : Set Œ±}, IsCompact s ‚Üí IsClosed t ‚Üí t ‚äÜ s ‚Üí IsCompact t",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A closed subset of a compact set is a compact set. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u} [inst : TopologicalSpace Œ±] [inst_1 : PreirreducibleSpace Œ±] {s : Set Œ±},\n  IsOpen s ‚Üí Set.Nonempty s ‚Üí Dense s",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "In a (pre)irreducible space, a nonempty open set is dense. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u} [inst : TopologicalSpace Œ±] [inst_1 : LocallyCompactSpace Œ±] {K : Set Œ±},\n  IsCompact K ‚Üí ‚àÉ K', IsCompact K' ‚àß K ‚äÜ interior K'",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "In a locally compact space, every compact set is contained in the interior of a compact set. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u} [t : TopologicalSpace Œ±] [inst : TopologicalSpace.SecondCountableTopology Œ±] {Œπ : Type u_1}\n  (s : Œπ ‚Üí Set Œ±), (‚àÄ (i : Œπ), IsOpen (s i)) ‚Üí ‚àÉ T, Set.Countable T ‚àß ‚ãÉ (i : Œπ) (_ : i ‚àà T), s i = ‚ãÉ (i : Œπ), s i",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "In a second-countable space, an open set, given as a union of open sets,\nis equal to the union of countably many of those sets. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u} [inst : EMetricSpace Œ±] {s : Set Œ±}, IsClosed s ‚Üí IsClosed {t | ‚Üët ‚äÜ s}",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "Subsets of a given closed subset form a closed set "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u} [inst : TopologicalSpace Œ±] [inst_1 : T2Space Œ±] {s : Set Œ±},\n  Set.Finite s ‚Üí ‚àÉ U, (‚àÄ (x : Œ±), x ‚àà U x ‚àß IsOpen (U x)) ‚àß Set.PairwiseDisjoint s U",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Points of a finite set can be separated by open sets from each other. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u} [inst : TopologicalSpace Œ±] {S U : Set Œ±},\n  IsPreirreducible S ‚Üí IsOpen U ‚Üí Set.Nonempty (S ‚à© U) ‚Üí S ‚äÜ closure (S ‚à© U)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "A nonempty open subset of a preirreducible subspace is dense in the subspace. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_1} [inst : TopologicalSpace Œ±] {C : Set Œ±} [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace.SecondCountableTopology Œ±],\n  IsClosed C ‚Üí ¬¨Set.Countable C ‚Üí ‚àÉ D, Perfect D ‚àß Set.Nonempty D ‚àß D ‚äÜ C",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Any uncountable closed set in a second countable space contains a nonempty perfect subset."}]

stmt: Every non-identity element of a free group is of infinite order.
prompts:

  "‚àÄ {G : Type u_1} [inst : Group G] {x : G}, IsOfFinOrder x‚Åª¬π ‚Üî IsOfFinOrder x",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "Inverses of elements of finite order have finite order. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_1} [self : LinearOrderedCommGroupWithZero Œ±] (a : Œ±), a ‚â† 0 ‚Üí a * a‚Åª¬π = 1",

  "docString": "Every nonzero element of a group with zero is invertible. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {G : Type u_1} [inst : Monoid G] {x : G}, 0 < orderOf x ‚Üî IsOfFinOrder x",

  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "A monoid is not a torsion monoid if it has an element of infinite order. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {G : Type u_2} {H : Type u_1} [inst : Monoid G] [inst_1 : Monoid H] (f : G ‚Üí* H) {x : G},\n  IsOfFinOrder x ‚Üí IsOfFinOrder (‚Üëf x)",

  "docString": "The image of an element of finite order has finite order. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {G : Type u_1} [inst : AddGroup G] {x : G}, IsOfFinAddOrder x ‚Üí IsOfFinAddOrder (-x)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Inverses of elements of finite additive order have finite additive order."},

  "‚àÄ {G : Type u_1} [inst : AddMonoid G] (H : AddSubmonoid G) (x : { x // x ‚àà H }), IsOfFinAddOrder x ‚Üî IsOfFinAddOrder ‚Üëx",

 {"theorem":

  "isProp": true,

 {"theorem":

 {"theorem":

  "isProp": true,

stmt: An element of a discrete valuation ring is a unit if and only if it has a valuation of zero.
prompts:
[{"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {K : Type u_2} [inst : DivisionRing K] {Œì‚ÇÄ : Type u_1} [inst_1 : LinearOrderedCommMonoidWithZero Œì‚ÇÄ]\n  [inst_2 : Nontrivial Œì‚ÇÄ] (v : Valuation K Œì‚ÇÄ) {x : K}, ‚Üëv x = 0 ‚Üî x = 0",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "If `v` is a valuation on a division ring then `v(x) = 0` iff `x = 0`. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {R : Type u_1} [inst : CommRing R] [inst_1 : IsDomain R] {s : Multiset (Ideal R)},\n  Multiset.prod s = ‚ä• ‚Üî ‚àÉ I, I ‚àà s ‚àß I = ‚ä•",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "A product of ideals in an integral domain is zero if and only if one of the terms is zero. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {M‚ÇÄ : Type u_1} [inst : MulZeroOneClass M‚ÇÄ], 0 = 1 ‚Üí ‚àÄ (a : M‚ÇÄ), a = 0",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "In a monoid with zero, if zero equals one, then zero is the only element. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {R : Type u} [inst : CommRing R] [inst_1 : IsDomain R] [inst_2 : UniqueFactorizationMonoid R],\n  (‚àÉ p, Irreducible p) ‚Üí (‚àÄ ‚¶Ép q : R‚¶Ñ, Irreducible p ‚Üí Irreducible q ‚Üí Associated p q) ‚Üí DiscreteValuationRing R",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "A unique factorization domain with at least one irreducible element\nin which all irreducible elements are associated\nis a discrete valuation ring.\n"},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ (R : Type u_1) [inst : CommRing R], Nonempty (Algebra ‚Ñö R) ‚Üî ‚àÄ (I : Ideal R), I ‚â† ‚ä§ ‚Üí CharZero (R ‚ß∏ I)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "A ring is a `‚Ñö`-algebra iff it has equal characteristic zero. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {R : Type u_2} {S : Type u_1} [inst : EuclideanDomain R] [inst_1 : CommRing S] [inst_2 : IsDomain S]\n  [inst_3 : Algebra R S] (abv : AbsoluteValue R ‚Ñ§) (I : { x // x ‚àà nonZeroDivisors (Ideal S) }),\n  ‚àÉ b, b ‚àà ‚ÜëI ‚àß b ‚â† 0 ‚àß ‚àÄ (c : S), c ‚àà ‚ÜëI ‚Üí ‚Üëabv (‚Üë(Algebra.norm R) c) < ‚Üëabv (‚Üë(Algebra.norm R) b) ‚Üí c = 0",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A nonzero ideal has an element of minimal norm. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {R : Type u} [inst : NonUnitalNonAssocRing R] (s : NonUnitalSubring R), 0 ‚àà s",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A non-unital subring contains the ring's 0. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {M‚ÇÄ : Type u_1} [inst : MonoidWithZero M‚ÇÄ] [inst_1 : Nontrivial M‚ÇÄ] (u : M‚ÇÄÀ£), ‚Üëu ‚â† 0",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "An element of the unit group of a nonzero monoid with zero represented as an element\nof the monoid is nonzero. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {R : Type u_1} [inst : CommRing R] [inst_1 : IsDomain R] [inst_2 : IsDedekindDomain R]\n  (v : IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum R), IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum.intValuationDef v 0 = 0",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "The `v`-adic valuation of `0 : R` equals 0. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {R : Type u} {S : Type v} {F : Type u_1} [inst : Semiring R] [inst_1 : Semiring S] [rcf : RingHomClass F R S] (f : F)\n  {r : R}, r ‚àà RingHom.ker f ‚Üî ‚Üëf r = 0",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "An element is in the kernel if and only if it maps to zero."}]

stmt: For any two relatively prime positive integers $a$ and $b$, every sufficiently large natural number $N$ can be written as a linear combination $ax + by$ of $a$ and $b$, where both $x$ and $y$ are natural numbers.
prompts:
[{"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {a b : ‚Ñ§}, a ‚â† 0 ‚Üí IsLeast {n | 0 < n ‚àß ‚àÉ x y, ‚Üën = a * x + b * y} (Int.gcd a b)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "For nonzero integers `a` and `b`, `gcd a b` is the smallest positive natural number that can be\nwritten in the form `a * x + b * y` for some pair of integers `x` and `y` "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_1} [inst : LinearOrderedRing Œ±] [inst_1 : Archimedean Œ±] {x y : Œ±},\n  1 ‚â§ x ‚Üí 1 < y ‚Üí ‚àÉ n, y ^ n ‚â§ x ‚àß x < y ^ (n + 1)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Every x greater than or equal to 1 is between two successive\nnatural-number powers of every y greater than one. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {a b x y u v : ‚Ñï}, a = x ^ 2 + y ^ 2 ‚Üí b = u ^ 2 + v ^ 2 ‚Üí ‚àÉ r s, a * b = r ^ 2 + s ^ 2",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "The set of natural numbers that are sums of two squares is closed under multiplication. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {a b : ‚Ñï},\n  a ‚â† 0 ‚Üí b ‚â† 0 ‚Üí List.toFinset (Nat.factors (a * b)) = List.toFinset (Nat.factors a) ‚à™ List.toFinset (Nat.factors b)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "If `a`, `b` are positive, the prime divisors of `a * b` are the union of those of `a` and `b` "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {a b : ‚Ñï}, a ‚â† 0 ‚Üí b ‚â† 0 ‚Üí Nat.factors (a * b) ~ Nat.factors a ++ Nat.factors b",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "For positive `a` and `b`, the prime factors of `a * b` are the union of those of `a` and `b` "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_1} [inst : OrderedAddCommMonoid Œ±] [self : Archimedean Œ±] (x : Œ±) {y : Œ±}, 0 < y ‚Üí ‚àÉ n, x ‚â§ n ‚Ä¢ y",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "For any two elements `x`, `y` such that `0 < y`, there exists a natural number `n`\nsuch that `x ‚â§ n ‚Ä¢ y`. "},
 {"theorem": "‚àÄ {m n : ‚Ñï}, (‚àÄ (a : ‚Ñï), m ‚à£ a ‚Üî n ‚à£ a) ‚Üî m = n",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Two natural numbers are equal if and only if they have the same multiples. "},
 {"theorem": "Set.InjOn Nat.factorization {x | x ‚â† 0}",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Every nonzero natural number has a unique prime factorization "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {a b : ‚Ñï}, Nat.coprime a b ‚Üí Nat.factors (a * b) ~ Nat.factors a ++ Nat.factors b",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "For coprime `a` and `b`, the prime factors of `a * b` are the union of those of `a` and `b` "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {a b : ‚Ñï},\n  Nat.coprime a b ‚Üí (Nat.factorization (a * b)).support = (Nat.factorization a).support ‚à™ (Nat.factorization b).support",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "For coprime `a` and `b` the prime factorization `a * b` is the union of those of `a` and `b` "}]

stmt: Every field is a ring.
prompts:
[{"theorem": "‚àÄ (K : Type u) [inst : Field K], ValuationRing K",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A field is a valuation ring. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {K : Type u_2} {L : Type u_1} [inst : Field K] [inst_1 : Field L] [inst_2 : Algebra K L] (S : IntermediateField K L),\n  0 ‚àà S",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "An intermediate field contains the ring's 0. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {K : Type u_2} {L : Type u_1} [inst : Field K] [inst_1 : Field L] [inst_2 : Algebra K L] (S : IntermediateField K L),\n  1 ‚àà S",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "An intermediate field contains the ring's 1. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ (Œ± : Type u_1) [inst : LinearOrderedField Œ±] [inst_1 : FloorRing Œ±], Archimedean Œ±",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A linear ordered field that is a floor ring is archimedean. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {R : Type u} [inst : Semiring R], IsField R ‚Üí ‚àÄ (x y : R), x * y = y * x",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "Fields are commutative. "},
 {"theorem":
  "CategoryTheory.Limits.HasLimitsOfSize.{v, v, max u v, max (u + 1) (v + 1)} CommSemiRingCatMax",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "The category of rings has all limits. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {K : Type u} [inst : DivisionSemiring K] (I : Ideal K), I = ‚ä• ‚à® I = ‚ä§",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "All ideals in a division (semi)ring are trivial. "},
 {"theorem": "‚àÄ {R : Type u} [inst : Semiring R], IsField R ‚Üí ‚àÉ x y, x ‚â† y",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "For a semiring to be a field, it must have two distinct elements. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ (K : Type u_1) [inst : Field K] [nf : NumberField K], ¬¨IsField { x // x ‚àà NumberField.ringOfIntegers K }",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "The ring of integers of a number field is not a field. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ (self : AlgebraicGeometry.LocallyRingedSpace) (x : ‚Üë‚Üëself.toPresheafedSpace),\n  LocalRing ‚Üë(TopCat.Presheaf.stalk self.presheaf x)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "Stalks of a locally ringed space are local rings. "}]

stmt: The set of units in a ring forms a group.
prompts:
[{"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {R : Type u_1} [inst : NormedRing R] [inst_1 : CompleteSpace R], IsOpen {x | IsUnit x}",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "The group of units of a complete normed ring is an open subset of the ring. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {R : Type u_1} [inst : CommRing R] [inst_1 : IsDomain R] (S : Subgroup RÀ£) [inst_2 : Finite { x // x ‚àà S }],\n  IsCyclic { x // x ‚àà S }",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "A finite subgroup of the units of an integral domain is cyclic. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {R : Type u_2} {G : Type u_1} [inst : CommRing R] [inst_1 : IsDomain R] [inst_2 : Group G] [inst_3 : Finite G]\n  (f : G ‚Üí* R), Function.Injective ‚Üëf ‚Üí IsCyclic G",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "A finite subgroup of the unit group of an integral domain is cyclic. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {G : Type u_1} [inst : Group G] [inst_1 : Finite G], Monoid.IsTorsion G",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "Finite groups are torsion groups. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {G : Type u_1} [inst : Group G], SMulCommClass G { x // x ‚àà Subgroup.center G } G",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "The center of a group acts commutatively on that group. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {G : Type u_1} [inst : Group G] {k : Set G}, k ‚äÜ ‚Üë(Subgroup.closure k)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "The subgroup generated by a set includes the set. "},
 {"theorem":
  "LieGroup (modelWithCornersSelf ‚Ñù (EuclideanSpace ‚Ñù (Fin 1))) { x // x ‚àà circle }",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "The unit circle in `‚ÑÇ` is a Lie group. "},
 {"theorem": "‚àÄ {R : Type u} [inst : Ring R] (s : Subring R), 0 ‚àà s",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A subring contains the ring's 0. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_1} [inst : NormedDivisionRing Œ±], TopologicalDivisionRing Œ±",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A normed division ring is a topological division ring. "},
 {"theorem": "‚àÄ {R : Type u} [inst : Ring R] (s : Subring R), 1 ‚àà s",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A subring contains the ring's 1. "}]

stmt: If the direct product of two groups is torsion free then each of the groups is torsion free.
prompts:
[{"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ∑ : Type u_1} {Gs : Œ∑ ‚Üí Type u_2} [inst : (i : Œ∑) ‚Üí Group (Gs i)],\n  (‚àÄ (i : Œ∑), Monoid.IsTorsionFree (Gs i)) ‚Üí Monoid.IsTorsionFree ((i : Œ∑) ‚Üí Gs i)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "Direct products of torsion free groups are torsion free. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {Œ∑ : Type u_1} {Gs : Œ∑ ‚Üí Type u_2} [inst : (i : Œ∑) ‚Üí AddGroup (Gs i)],\n  (‚àÄ (i : Œ∑), AddMonoid.IsTorsionFree (Gs i)) ‚Üí AddMonoid.IsTorsionFree ((i : Œ∑) ‚Üí Gs i)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Direct products of additive torsion free groups are torsion free."},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {G : Type u_1} [inst : Group G], Monoid.IsTorsionFree G ‚Üí ‚àÄ (H : Subgroup G), Monoid.IsTorsionFree { x // x ‚àà H }",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "Subgroups of torsion-free groups are torsion-free. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {G : Type u_1} [inst : AddGroup G],\n  AddMonoid.IsTorsionFree G ‚Üí ‚àÄ (H : AddSubgroup G), AddMonoid.IsTorsionFree { x // x ‚àà H }",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Subgroups of additive torsion-free groups are additively torsion-free."},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ (G : Type u_1) [inst : CommGroup G], Monoid.IsTorsionFree (G ‚ß∏ CommGroup.torsion G)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Quotienting a group by its torsion subgroup yields a torsion free group. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ (G : Type u_1) [inst : AddCommGroup G], AddMonoid.IsTorsionFree (G ‚ß∏ AddCommGroup.torsion G)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Quotienting a group by its additive torsion subgroup yields an additive torsion free group."},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {G : Type u_1} {H : Type u_2} [inst : Group G] {N : Subgroup G} [inst_1 : Group H] {f : G ‚Üí* H},\n  N = MonoidHom.ker f ‚Üí Monoid.IsTorsion H ‚Üí Monoid.IsTorsion { x // x ‚àà N } ‚Üí Monoid.IsTorsion G",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "Torsion groups are closed under extensions. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {G : Type u_1} [inst : Group G], Monoid.IsTorsion G ‚Üí ‚àÄ (H : Subgroup G), Monoid.IsTorsion { x // x ‚àà H }",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "Subgroups of torsion groups are torsion groups. "},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {G : Type u_1} [inst : AddGroup G], AddMonoid.IsTorsion G ‚Üí ‚àÄ (H : AddSubgroup G), AddMonoid.IsTorsion { x // x ‚àà H }",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Subgroups of additive torsion groups are additive torsion groups."},
 {"theorem":
  "‚àÄ {G : Type u_1} [inst : Group G] [inst_1 : Finite G], Monoid.IsTorsion G",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "Finite groups are torsion groups. "}]
